intro: Phacellothrix cladochaeta, commonly known as the clustered haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green, glossy leaves that are often curved at the tips. The plant produces small, spore-bearing capsules that are typically clustered in dense groups, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Phacellothrix cladochaeta is an important component of many temperate and boreal ecosystems, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms.
